metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0209 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the d2i_ECPrivateKey function incrypto/ec/ec_asn1.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8zf, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0r, 1.0.1before 1.0.1m, and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2a might allow remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed Elliptic Curve (EC)private-key file that is improperly handled during import.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0209` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu11
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu11').
